activities.loc: Waushara Co. Courthouse 2nd Floor Room 230, Branch 1

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

22CF49 & 22CF122 Cases called @ 1:05 PM Defendant Percy J. Schmelzle appeared by phone.  Attorney Matthew Leusink in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Evan J Dahl appeared by phone for Percy J. Schmelzle. Receipt of complaint Admitted - Reading Waived. The Court entertains wavier of the preliminary hearing in both cases. Cases 22CF122 & 22CF49 called @ 1:40 PM Defendant Percy J. Schmelzle in court, in custody.  Attorney Dennis Ryan in court for State of Wisconsin. Statement by Court regarding SPD appointment status. The Court will appoint an attorney to represent the DE in both matters. The Court finds good cause exists to adjourn the AIA and extend any timelines relevant to the Preliminary Hearing to allow appointment to take place. AIA scheduled - NOH given. Statement by ADA Ryan regarding bond modification request by DE. Bond modification argument by ADA Ryan. The Court respectfully declines bond modification.

Case called @ 1:46 PM Defendant Percy J. Schmelzle in court, in custody.  Attorney Dennis Ryan in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant is eligible for SPD services but an attorney has not yet been appointed. The Court will adjourn the IA for counsel to be appointed.

Cash Bond Signed - $1500 - 5/31/2022

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

Case called @ 1:24 PM Defendant Percy J. Schmelzle appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Dennis Ryan in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Emma K Blankschein appeared by phone for Percy J. Schmelzle. Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and potential punishment.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant is eligible for SPD. Bond argument by ADA Ryan. Bond argument by Atty Blankschein. Court orders $1,500 cash bond. IA Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.
